B09H3ZWV3S.title: The Case of the Almost Perfect Hoodie
B09H3ZWV3S.review: I really wanted to love these hoodies, but sadly, I will not be keeping them. The GOOD: Very plush fabric, cozy, nicely over-sized, colors as depicted, decently made, and a perfect athleisure staple. THE BAD: Very cheap metal zipper that stalls, catches, and looks shoddy. One of the hoodies I purchased had a zipper with defective teeth, so I couldn't zip it all the way up. Adding to this, the hood is extremely pointy and sits at the top of your head. If you are trying to live that gnome life or give gnome vibes, this hoodie is a must. THE UGLY: Again, for the folks in the back: cheap zipper and pointy hood. I hope they revamp this hoodie one day, because those two minor adjustments could make it the PERFECT hoodie. For now, it's a no from me, dawg.

This simply fits like a large, which...I don't wear.The zipper on this is also pretty stiff/difficult where it hooks, though I wonder if that's just a fluke with the one I got because once hooked, it seems pretty normal otherwise. B07KWDH8HD.title: The H&M killer.
B07KWDH8HD.review: Not much I can add beyond the other 4 star reviews, it fits very well, and it pronounces the shoulder quite well. The material doesn't feel cheap, and it took quite the amount of "damage", from weddings to late night outings...it can handle the stress.One button...sounds treacherous, but this jacket outlasted a tux rental for said wedding, from Men's Warehouse. That should be enough to get you to pull the trigger. If you're still worried, go to a tailor and have them resew it tighter, but from my experience, I was opening and closing, sitting with it closed, and walking with this jacket everywhere...no button malfunctions.The one and only con I had; the "black" color, its more like a heather gray, there's not one instant where it could ever be called or confused as black. You're looking for "Dark Black"...which is the universal black we vampires all come to know and love. Its an off brand third party Chinese maker, so I'll give them that mulligan, especially since I could've sent it back, but I didn't (liked it too much).That's it...go buy one, get outta here.

B07KWDH8HD.title: Good jacket but NOT AS SHOWN! NOT SLIM AT THE WAIST!
B07KWDH8HD.review: I ended up buying several of these, but I had to have them altered at the dry cleaners. Why do so many images on Amazon show slim/athletic cut waists in jackets and shirts, when the actual product is boxy and square when you get it. Talk about false advertising. I guess it's because people are so overweight these days, they're relieved when they get it that way. But some of us are actually still thin and in shape, and I'd love to be able to buy a jacket (or shirt) that fits me without spending more to have it altered.Once the alterations were done, these jackets are actually quite nice. They're nothing to wear to a 5-star restaurant, but they're great for a semi-casual look, and they work well with both jeans and casual slacks Try a turtleneck under it for a very nice look!

B08XJFWK3D.title: ShadyBusiness Practices

B00L3ESYXC.title: Lovely coat
B00L3ESYXC.review: Shipping was very fast. I was a bit worried when this showed up on my doorstep in a bag, but it was wrapped up nicely and even came with a hanger.The garment itself is lovely. It’s heavy and you can feel the wool (slightly scratchy but will definitely keep you warm). I saw many comments saying that it is a knock-off brand, but I don’t care whatsoever about brand names. The price point was great compared to other similar coats and the quality seems great. The buttons seem like they are sewn on well, but if any fall off, that is an easy fix and not one that I will complain about. Due to many comments about this coat fitting a bit large, I sized down (and very glad I did). I usually get mediums, but I ordered a small and it fits perfectly!It’s snug but not tight. I might even have room to layer under it, but I live in California, so that won’t be necessary unless I travel.

B00L3ESYXC.title: Pretty but…
B00L3ESYXC.review: The coat is very pretty. It has a nice pea coat structure & is super flattering on. But…this is not a true Anne Klein coat. The inside label is cheap & totally off centered. The tags were not authentic & there were threads everywhere that had to be snipped back. That being said, I’m keeping it because it fits well & looks nice. I just hope it doesn’t fall apart on me.

B00L3ESYXC.title: One caveat
B00L3ESYXC.review: I originally wanted a classic pea coat with SHAPE. When you lose fifty pounds (60 down, 70 to go...) and your shape is naturally curvy, you want to SEE those curves you used to have. Something about the longer shape on this one drew me in - and I'm glad I chose it. I got the XXL because I wanted a little extra space all around for layering underneath (got that, on the body). But the problem with nearly everything I ever bought when I was very large and now, still sometimes, as I scale down, is when clothing manufacturers upsize a garment they don't seem to understand they cannot bypass the armhole/sleeve area. If a person is overweight across the chest you have to know you're going to have to cut a roomier garment there AND through the armholes/arms, as well. With my weight loss (currently hovering around 197 lbs/size 16), I can wear the coat without another layer underneath. It's going to be snug with a fitted hoodie, however. And there's no way the armholes wouldn't have been impossible (XXL, remember) at 250 lbs.At any rate, at under 200lbs NOW this is a beautiful coat, with a flattering mid-thigh length and slight princess fit/flare. Details I thought might be distracting (the cuff bands) are actually quite lovely. I hope this coat is still here when I'm smaller because it's already slimming and kind of "hot." But if I were a size 8 it would REALLY look smashing!Just don't be surprised if the armholes kill the deal if you're bigger than a size 16. If they'd cut it properly at the armholes it would have been flattering on a size 24.

B08M4JN955.title: A versatile jacket for cold climates!
B08M4JN955.review: I love this jacket! I live in Colorado, where I was always bummed that “Jean jacket weather” only last two months at most, before it either became too hot or too cold for one (though mostly the latter).But now thanks to this jacket I finally get to wear this jean jacket way past the normal “Jean jacket weather,” because of how warm it keeps me!Plus I decided to get one size larger then I normally order for jackets, for the express purpose of layering a sweater or second jacket underneath, and then I’m able to even wear this jacket on a snowy day!Overall this jacket is really great quality, and I foresee myself getting as much wear out of it as possible for many years to come!

B08M4JN955.title: Cute style
B08M4JN955.review: I purchased both a medium and a large. I’m 145lbs, 5’7 with a 29 inch waist measurement and a 36D. Overall, I love this jacket and it seems like it will be warm enough for mild cold days - though the sleeves are not sherpa lined. Also, the material attracts lint like crazy.There isn’t much difference between the two sizes in terms of length. The large is rather big on me, but would be perfect to layer a thin sweater underneath. I prefer the fit of the medium, which is my true size, and only plan to wear long sleeves underneath so I’m not concerned about the extra room.

The black screen may look cool in product photos but is virtually unreadable in anything other than direct sunlight. The black version of the watch has a more classic light display which avoids this issue entirely and is my calculator watch of choice.

Ive always loved the old Casio calculator watches for there novelty, and Im a bit old...So remember them from being a kid.I love the watch...But there are two issue I wish I had paid a bit more attention to, though they are mostly slight inconveniences as opposed to actual problems, and dont detract from my enjoying the watch. 1. being the watch does NOT have a back light, so You cant read the time at night. 2. The color way for the display is in revere ("White" numbers/font with a black back ground) and this makes being able to read the time next to impossible without direct light shining directly on it.So if you dont mind those two issue, for $20 its a pretty awesome watch.

B07QY4HSL1.title: Not worth the price
B07QY4HSL1.review: I bought these booties about a year ago and have always liked the way they looked and how they were moderately comfortable for having a little heel. However, when I bought them over a year ago they were less than $50. I came to Amazon to purchase another pair and saw they are now listed at $90… they are not worth almost $100. I had these for maybe a few months before the inside of the soles were coming apart, but I didn’t mind because they were decently priced. Now the bottom piece of the heel has completely come apart and because the inside sole didn’t last long, they are so uncomfortable.For a Dr scholls shoe, these were okay considering the price but now that they are $90 it just isn’t worth it. If you’re looking for comfort and long lasting, spend your money elsewhere.

Like others have said, the heels nick very quickly unfortunately, but my issue is the blue liner in the foot bed. The left side glue came off almost instantly and would bunch up under the arch of my foot! This morning, after months of this annoyance, I ripped that blue liner off, but the glue was still holding where the toes are, so now I have ripped off part of the layer below that! My feet do not hurt by the end of the day but they are CHEAPLY made. I would probably not purchase again unless they make major changes in quality.

B01KJMDK1E.title: Great Backpack for the price
B01KJMDK1E.review: This is a great EDC bag. It also works great for short travel and day hikes.

B01KJMDK1E.title: Holding up good.
B01KJMDK1E.review: This was a replacement duty bag. It's working out fine. Use daily. Seams OK. Zippers OK. Would like to see a little more "hook and latch" for morale patches.

B01KJMDK1E.title: Works well, until it breaks
B01KJMDK1E.review: This pack looks cool and holds a lot of stuff. I used it for ROTC in college and general college student stuff. It also worked great for travel as its size allowed me to fit multiple days worth of clothes. The MOLLE system let me attach a convenient water bottle holder to the side.HOWEVER, after about 14 months it finally broke apart in multiple spots. The thing about this pack is that the stitching DOES NOT LAST for too long. I was able to sew up the lower pocket when it broke open, but this zipper situation (picture attached) is beyond my skills.In conclusion, it's a great entry level tactical backpack, but I will be moving onto more premium and durable packs. Maybe a 5.11 Rush or something else.

B01KJMDK1E.title: Zippers are not that durable
B01KJMDK1E.review: I bought the black one two years ago and its a great bag! Used it mainly for work and my bug out bag. Travel with it and camping with it. The problem is the zippers on the one pocket I mainly used to keep my personal stuff. The plastic zippers came off the stitches and derailed and bent the heck of it. Thats why I took that pocket off because it’s useless now. And I noticed the waist buckle on the tan one is smaller than the black one that I previously bought. I guessed they cutting corners now because of the price of the materials go high. I wont expect it to be like that for jacking the price $5 more. I bought the black one only for $35 2 years ago. Other than that I love the bag and bought another one in tan color. I hope it will hold up more than two years with rigorous used and the zipper will last longer.

B01KJMDK1E.title: Durable
B01KJMDK1E.review: I use this as a ruck due to my small size. It has straps around the waist and the chest making it comfortable! Would recommend!

B01KJMDK1E.title: Loved it until…
B01KJMDK1E.review: This backpack has been amazing and I’ve loved it, but I’ve had it less than a year and the zipper just broke. Is there some kind of warranty to get a replacement for a discounted price or do I just have to buy a new one?

B01KJMDK1E.title: Sturdy as heck.
B01KJMDK1E.review: I got this back pack for fire school and i throw it around and i also carry about 3 hugggeee text books and it’s holding up great.

B01KJMDK1E.title: This is great
B01KJMDK1E.review: Roomy bag- I work away from home and don’t know when I will be back. I bring a lot of stuff with me in case I don’t get back on time- it is roomy and you can use the straps to expand or make it smaller.

B01KJMDK1E.title: No laptop compartment!
B01KJMDK1E.review: Those who say it fits a laptop are misleading. Of course, a laptop will fit in the bag because it is spacious! However, there is no *padded compartment* or space for a laptop. It must sit in one of the two larger compartments along with the rest of your gear. My concern is that if the bag is set down hard, then the laptop absorbs the brunt of the force. There is nothing to soften the blow. Perhaps those who say a laptop fits have a small 13" MacBook or similar size. My 15" Dell will not fit in any compartments except the two primary ones.

B01KJMDK1E.title: My Son's Favorite Christmas Gift
B01KJMDK1E.review: My son who is active duty needed a backpack.He loved it so much!!He told everyone this was his favorite gift.

B01KJMDK1E.title: Looks good, , butmy inner lingerie nettingripped.

B01KJMDK1E.title: Not military tan, but good bag
B01KJMDK1E.review: This appears to be a solidly constructed bag. Only time will tell if it is durable.If the light color military tan is important to you, don’t get this bag. What you get is something like a darker brown tinged with green.Didn’t matter much to me, except for the little white lie in advertising, but it might matter to you.

B01KJMDK1E.title: Good quality
B01KJMDK1E.review: Some of the Clips in the front side. Around your waist and chest have fallen off. You can put them back on but they're not very sturdy as far as longevity and staying on. The side clips have bands and hold very well. The backpack has a lot of space and compartments which I really like being able to separate and find things. I've taken this on a 3-week motorcycle trip, camping, and everyday work use for a year and it's held up really well.

B01KJMDK1E.title: Excellent design.
B01KJMDK1E.review: Sturdy and the compartments are laid out well and big enough to accommodate and organize the contents in a usable for almost any adventure.

B01KJMDK1E.title: Awesome backpack for everyday use!
B01KJMDK1E.review: I like to have the best of the best while getting the best bang for my buck. So after searching all over Amazon for a good quality backpack that will hold up for a while, I gave this brand a try. It’s exactly what I was looking for. So much space & little pockets to store a lot of gear. I also added some patches to add a little spice to my awesome backpack. Definitely recommend

B01KJMDK1E.title: Quality has gone way downhill
B01KJMDK1E.review: Purchased this same pack in 2019 and I use it often and it has held up great.Wanted to get a tan one of the same pack, and the quality of this one is subpar. Straps and backing have little to no cushion like my previous pack and everything feels thinner and cheaper.

B01KJMDK1E.title: Review long in the making
B01KJMDK1E.review: This bag is excellent. For a little background, I got this for use at work, which is military work. I carried this thing to close to 15 field exercises, overseas to five countries on both commercial and military flights with a week's worth of equipment between it and my military medium ruck, and carried all my crap to work or class every day since 2019. Only after nearly four years has one of the bottom seams started giving out. Everything else is just as solid as the day I purchased it even with the wear on the shoulder straps. I have carried close to 150lbs in this and that is likely why I have a seam break, so entirely my own fault. If you are looking for a reliable tactical style bag, this is the way to go.

B01KJMDK1E.title: Worth Every Penny!!!
B01KJMDK1E.review: I ordered this backpack in two different colors for two of my children this school year.They have been using them for four months now.Both of my boys are in junior high and are very hard on their backpacks.They both said there is plenty of room and the zippers have held up very well.The packs have comfortable straps.The backpacks show no sign of wear and are very sturdy.I would definitely recommend this backpack brand.I will be buying this product again in the far future as I expect them to hold up for at least two school years if not more.

B01KJMDK1E.title: Highly recommended!
B01KJMDK1E.review: Love this bag, great quality. I use it as my range bag.Very happy with the purchase.

B01KJMDK1E.title: An incredible backpack!
B01KJMDK1E.review: I've gone through eight different backpacks. They've been all terrible, except for this one. It's comfy (adjust those straps!), it's roomy so you can store a lot (I put my groceries inside or my work things) and it has tons of additional small pockets for storage, including a pouch slip to put in a hydration pack. It's survived heavy rain, too, but nothing inside got wet. I wouldn't suggest constantly letting it get soaked of course, but it saved my stuff when I didn't expect rain.I would 100% recommend this backpack!

B01KJMDK1E.title: I use it everyday
B01KJMDK1E.review: I use this bag every day for work and it’s perfect. Super spacious and has plenty of room for you to stuff random things in.

B01KJMDK1E.title: It’s what I was looking for
B01KJMDK1E.review: It’s pretty much what I was looking for to replace my old one very similar to it. The quality is pretty good too. Although it did smell weird when I first got it but it’s fine now.The only complaint I have is somehow there’s strings that keep getting caught in the zipper from the inside so not only is that annoying but I’m assuming it’s pulling at the seam somewhere so it’s only a matter of time before that fails in a spot.All in all, good bag. I like the Velcro on the front and it came with the American flag patch too.

B01KJMDK1E.review: Purchased this backpack for my husband about a 1.5 years ago.He uses the bag for work and doesn’t abuse it.However the zippers have not held up, the main zipper has torn away from the structure of the main compartment and the zipper does not zip to close. The zipper on a smaller compartment has also broken.He really liked the bag so we ordered another one because of the price point and all of the compartments.He is disappointed that it is such a good bag but didn’t hold up.We are considering taking it in to have the zippers fixed so he can use it for hunting.

B01KJMDK1E.title: A great value

I hope to never use it (if I'm using it, the SHTF), but if I do, I have every confidence that this bag will more than suffice to get me home. A person could pay a LOT more money for a similar bag, but for the price of some of these high-priced bags, I could buy 4-5 of these bags.

I kept feeling my gear digging into my back and the straps aren’t very sturdy for weight bearing or distribution so it did murder on my neck and shoulders.

It's very durable and keeps me hydrated! The color red looks fantastic and it's so easy to clean. I plan to buy another one...one for work and the other for hiking.

B07N2F3JXP.title: Leak proof think again
B07N2F3JXP.review: I like the bottle but it leaks. I have learned not to give reviews until i have used something bought on Amazon for a while or to point out that i just got it and so far so good. With this bottle i was misled and bought it on its promise on the page i viewed here on Amazon saying it would not leak. Shame on the company for making an untrue blanket statement and shame on Amazon for not making them retract the statement. Its a shame you cannot trust products bought on Amazon when they have the ability to help their customers as much as they help the people that sell things here. A way to do that would be an oversight system based on easily contacted reviewers.Dont be happy that you got something new and make it the best thing going until youve used a few months. We will help each other out by weeding the crap out before the stats get skewed only based on the number of people who bought it.

B00WH1RTTU.title: Don’t lose the rubber stopper!
B00WH1RTTU.review: My kids have a talent for losing pieces of their water bottles at school. After the first week of use, one came home without the rubber stopper. Now the water bottle is as useful a tin can. Wouldn’t recommend for kids use. Adults? Sure.

B00WH1RTTU.review: Love the size, the snap top and durability in the dishwasher. The hole from which to drink is quite small though. You either put your top lip in and get what you get, or you put your lips around it and it creates a suction. Design could be slightly better but overall a decent bottle now that they don't make the Rubbermaid ones anymore.

B00WH1RTTU.title: Good price for a great bottle
B00WH1RTTU.review: Very comfortable to drink from. No dribbles down my chin. Doesn’t leak and is easy to clean. I especially like the measurements on the side of the bottle as I have to keep up with my fluid intake and that makes it easier.

B00WH1RTTU.title: Pretty good!
B00WH1RTTU.review: I use it for my everyday practice, its reliable and sturdy for the price. Would buy another if needed.

B00WH1RTTU.title: Quality product

B00WH1RTTU.title: Really good

B0834X56QF.title: Best Travel Bottle Yet
B0834X56QF.review: I've used all types of containers for carrying water for work and travel.I specifically purchased this bottle because I wanted to be able to carry soda water and I need a screw cap with a seal.This bottle has worked really well.I purchased a 1-L sleeve separately to insulate the bottle and protect if from clanging into other objects.I'm very please with the quality.It seals well even under carbonation pressure.I can now get rid of all the other water bottles that I own.:)

B0834X56QF.title: lightweight, keeps water cool.
B0834X56QF.review: Use this water bottle at school. Lightweight and keeps water cool.

B0834X56QF.title: Average water bottle

I would probably glue it to fix that, but I would also be concerned with toxic fumes from the glue when I bring the bottle into the sauna.The 750ml bottle weighs 7.1oz if anyone is curious. It’s a pretty light bottle for it being stainless. See weights for the Gatorade bottle (same 750ml) and the standard Nalgene (1000ml) for reference. Both being lighter.

B0834X56QF.title: value and qulity Good

B0834X56QF.title: Great product

B0834X56QF.title: A lot to like!

Stainless steel and it’s unpainted2. 17 oz is good size for me.3.The handle on top is great.4.Lightweight—I don’t need an insulated bottle which adds more weight.The only thing I’m questioning is whether the gasket on the cover is plastic.However, without it the bottle will leak.

B0834X56QF.title: Bamboo Cap Not Glued On - Separates Easily
B0834X56QF.review: This bottle has a design flaw: the bamboo cylinder in the top separates from the steel cap and has no way of becoming reattached (minus potting it into the cap with epoxy).Once the bamboo is gone, the steel cap has a thin and sharp edge that is difficult & uncomfortable to grasp.My bottle is now unusable. Will try a different design next time.

B0834X56QF.title: Save the planet not your patience.
B0834X56QF.review: Meh. The top bamboo insert came out within two weeks. Still holding water.

B0834X56QF.title: Excellent

B0834X56QF.title: Great Water Bottle
B0834X56QF.review: Read many reviews saying this bottle wasn't suitable for boiling water.I purchased it anyway and have been very satisfied.Took this on an extended back country cold weather hike and boiled a lot of water with it as an alternative to filtering in some situations.Very satisfied.It has a coating on it to protect the finish but after boiling water in the bottle the finish wiped off easily with a wet wipe and now it is just a stainless steel bottle.Attached is a photo of the bottle boiling some spruce tip tea, it works great.

B0834X56QF.title: Great customer service
B0834X56QF.review: This water bottle is simple with big opening, therefore very easy to clean, which is a relief after using so many water bottles with numerous nooks and crannies. No plastic, water only touches stainless steel and tiny bit of a silicone gasket, that's the gold standard. Great and responsive customer service.

B0834X56QF.title: Pretty bottle but lid is clunky.
B0834X56QF.review: Disappointed in the quality of the screw on lid. Loose milling and lid binds and grinds.

B0834X56QF.title: Great bottle but get the double wall insulation

B0834X56QF.title: Returned - not impressed

B0834X56QF.title: Just what I needed

B0834X56QF.title: Decent bottle
B0834X56QF.review: Seems decent enough, water tastes like water.

B0834X56QF.title: perfect
B0834X56QF.review: My husband loves this. so convenient.

B0834X56QF.title: Great bottle for half & half in my refrigerator
B0834X56QF.review: I'm a but picky when it comes to organization in my refrigerator. I always keep a half gallon of half & half for my coffee, but i don't like the big, ugly paper cartons. I have been looking for an un-insulated stainless bottle for it and this one works great. I thought about a clear glass bottle foe it, but apparently it's important to store milk products in opaque containers because supposedly the light can make it spoil faster. This bottle keeps the milk dark, and holds a little more than a quart, so a half gallon container will refill it twice.I keep the ugly paper container in the garage fridge and wash and refill this stainless bottle about once a week. Now the inside of my kitchen refrigerator looks nice and neat.

B0834X56QF.title: Well made sturdaly fashioned!!
B0834X56QF.review: Keeps cold drink's cold!! & Keeps hot drink's hot!! For Longer.

B0834X56QF.title: Handle broke
B0834X56QF.review: Over all nice, I bought a few which worked well but the handle broke on one only after a few weeks of use.

B0834X56QF.title: It’s pretty bad…
B0834X56QF.review: I have a lot of Major things to say about this product first it does not keep your water cold I Thought the whole point of a water bottle was supposed to keep your water cold so your able to drink it but not even 30 minutes to an hour all of the ice had melted and the water was room temperature Second this water bottle does not have a great top the top is very very Lose when you tighten it all the wayit’ll just go twist back around and come off Third just to put the icing on the cake this water bottle started to rust literally rust I saw it in the bottom of the water bottle when I looked inside of it to fill up my water bottle that one morning I looked inside and found rust in the water bottle after I had went through the ice melting the cap falling off and water spilling all over the place I’m so done with this water bottle I’m so glad I threw it away (don’t buy at all its not worth the hassle)

B0834X56QF.title: Not a Yeti!….. but good for the money.
B0834X56QF.review: Expected at least a liner or doubles walled design but has none. I love the fact that it’s stainless steel, not the highest quality but can be sterilized. Shop around. You can get a similar non-Yeti brand very similar with doublers stainless steel walled design with insulation. I found it. And I’ll use this for kicking around with ice in it during the hot summer.

B0834X56QF.title: Very disappointed

Also one has a finish on the bamboo so there may be a little mystery bag element to ordering, at least it’s not in contact with water.

B0834X56QF.title: Handling and delivery was on time.

BTW I have other stainless steel water bottles and none of them yield a metal taste.Really too bad as this is the only flaw, but is is a deal breaker.

Who knows, I may buy another one and replace my plastic bottles once and for all. I recommend this product.

The most important feature is that because it is HD stainless you can remove the O-ring and boil water in it over an open fire. Afterwards cool off and re-insertthe O-ring

B07PY3D9M7.review: Just received this pack today. It comes neatly packed into one of its own zippered pockets - neat. Once I open it up I was pleasantly surprised with how much space and practicality this thing has! The zippers are buttery smooth and although its made of a lightweight material, the material seems like rip stop and very durable. Can't wait to take it on my trip next month. I'm a guy and this has plenty of room for a 5 day trip. I'm very happy with this purchase.

B07PY3D9M7.title: Perfect for hiking or travel
B07PY3D9M7.review: Bought this for a road trip through Iceland and I never was tight for space! For reference, I kept my Nikon camera gear, gloves, hats, wallet, passport, tripod, and SO much more in here. There’s a ton of compartments for smaller and larger items. I even had space to add things I bought along the way into my bag. When you’re done with it, the bag folds into itself and can be easily stored into the front compartment of a luggage or carry on (it gets pretty flat). Durable and waterproof as well as it was raining and none of my items were touched by the rain! Awesome price too! Highly recommend this backpack

B07PY3D9M7.title: Red is not bright
B07PY3D9M7.review: Really like this backpack, had previously bought the bright blue one.Needed another one so I wanted the bright red, it’s more of a dark red definitely not bright!

After the trip, it folds up and can be stored away easily.I had this backpack PACKED and there was no tearing even after a weeks trip. I especially was fond of the waterproof pocket. It’s ideal for keeping passports, phones, and other important items safe if you’re near water. Enjoy!

B07PY3D9M7.title: Simply Amazing!!
B07PY3D9M7.review: These bags are incredibly durable, I use it for everything! It’s also great having the ability to fold up the backpack and take it into places that don’t allow backpacks.

B077K6BNXL.title: Amazing pack so light but so rigid
B077K6BNXL.review: There is nothing not to like about this osprey pack. Lightweight. Super resilient hold shape, and antigravity. System is amazing!

B077K6BNXL.title: Bought new but used item delivered
B077K6BNXL.review: Item delivered with sign of previous usage.

B077K6BNXL.title: Excellent upgrade to a military pack
B077K6BNXL.review: Love everything about my pack. Great product,great company,excellent warranty. What a wonderful upgrade to what I had been using.

B077K6BNXL.review: "quick adjust" waist belt system failed after two uses. The Velcro no longer holds the adjustment pads in, so when you tighten the belt they just slide out. Terrible design.

B077K6BNXL.title: Best Pack Period!
B077K6BNXL.review: If your thinking about it, Don't think just buy it. This is THE Pack for everything, and it does it all extremely well. It is beyond comfortable, form fitting and can carry everything you would possibly need. Ive had this pack for a little over 3 years and have had Zero issues with it. Highly recommenced! Get them before they are gone, Osprey has discontinued this model for some unknown/Stupid reason. Why you discontinue your best product is beyond me. Bring it back, and with more color/custom options! Id buy three just on principle.

B077K6BNXL.title: Perfect!
B077K6BNXL.review: Decided to upgrade my pack for year 2 on the Appalachian Trail and this pack was amazing! Felt like it was half the weight of my previous pack. Very durable, there is a reason Osprey is considered top of the line. Didnt realize it when I bought it but the lifetime warranty is very comforting to know too. Would absolutely purchase again!

B077K6BNXL.title: It is too big
B077K6BNXL.review: I bought it as a gift. But when I received the package it was too big and heavy. And I can not put it in my luggage. Also, in the description it mentioned that it is light but honestly it was not.

B077K6BNXL.title: Comfortable
B077K6BNXL.review: It might weigh a little more than the lightest packs but the comfort outweighs the weight.

B077K6BNXL.title: Solid
B077K6BNXL.review: I got this pack to replace my Teton Sports pack, as it doesn't provide much ventilation and is heavy. It is really well made, and provides much better ventilation and comfort. The stitching is good, and has a very quality feel to it. It is a bit heavier than I wanted, but no heavier than I expected/was advertised. If comfort is a priority, give this bag a try.

B077K6BNXL.title: True to its hype
B077K6BNXL.review: It’s as good as they say it is.

B077K6BNXL.title: Excellent product
B077K6BNXL.review: Light, lots of storage pockets, adjustable fit

B077K6BNXL.title: Osprey doesn't care
B077K6BNXL.review: Luckily I bought at REI so I had a year to return. This backpack carries weight excellent, and is designed very well. However for years people have been complaining about the squeaking frame and the hip belt zipper pockets being extraordinarily hard to open. This been going on for at least 10 YEARs and I guess osprey doesn't care about the well-known complaints of people. The only thing they'll do on their warranty is have you send it in AT YOUR EXPENSE and they somehow coat the frame or something to get the squeak out of it, which should have been done in the first place. And the hip belt pockets are also unacceptable. I can't recommend this product

B077K6BNXL.title: Sublime pack, you want one!
B077K6BNXL.review: Most comfortable pack with a several pockets to stay organized! The Anti Gravity system does make a balanced load seem lighter with less back sweat!

B077K6BNXL.title: Osprey zipper popped off … Customer service time….Got trails to hit!!
B077K6BNXL.review: Used bag one trip! Loved it packed for second trip the following weekend and the outside zipper popped off! Osprey says online 10-12 weeks hoping when I come back from this weekend trip it will be less then that! Will redo this review after dealing with Customer service

B077K6BNXL.title: Meets my Needs!
B077K6BNXL.review: Just received it. I read many reviews on backpacks and this one fit my needs. I am packing it for a long weekend trip and it will handle everything I need to pack. I love how it fits. I hope I feel the same after the trip! After the long weekender, I am planning a week-long trip.

B077K6BNXL.title: Excellent
B077K6BNXL.review: Great fit lightweight durable

B077K6BNXL.title: Great packpack (just get the right size)
B077K6BNXL.review: I love this backpackWent on several treks with itI got the wrong size, but it still works. Next time I get an atmos I'll know which size to get :)

B077K6BNXL.title: Worth the money
B077K6BNXL.review: This pack holds more than expected. Been using other pack but this pack comes 2nd to no other. Great buy!

B077K6BNXL.title: Pinnacle of Comfort and Quality
B077K6BNXL.review: This backpack is extremely comfortable, has tons of space, and is durable. My first trip with this was 2 days, 20 miles in downpour rain with 45 lbs in it. No chafing, no issues maneuvering. Everything is adjustable, so it is worth messing with all of the settings until you find what works for you. Puts the weight on your hips, and lets plenty of air get to your back. I recommend getting the osprey pack liners as well, they kept all of my gear dry on my trip, and a wet sleeping bag is useless. Tons of pockets, configurations, places to stow and store. The perfect backpack for those long trips. It is fairly large, but can be half-packed and adjusted to work for any amount of gear. Nothing but praise for this pack, and Osprey as a brand.

B077K6BNXL.title: Very comfortable pack

B077K6BNXL.title: Excellent backpack with an annoying squeak
B077K6BNXL.review: I bought this backpack due to the solid reviews. This past weekend I got the chance to take the pack out for the first time - to Mount Whitney. I could fit a lot of stuff into the pack and it felt really comfortable when adjusted correctly. My big issue is that there is a terrible squeak that comes from the shoulder straps and the hip-belt with every step. It is super distracting and become downright annoying after a while - especially as you just want to hike in the wilderness with no annoying sounds. I checked out reviews after I got back and it turns out that this pack has always had an issue with squeaking. There is a post by an REI rep from 2018, where they claim that they fixed the issue with the packs from that year onwards. However, going by my experience and reading other reviews, it seems they have not fixed the issue ... or it is a QC issue. Some folks don't seem to have this problem.If you buy one, then just make sure you load it up as you would for your camping trip and walk around a bit to ensure that you don't have the squeak. For me personally, Osprey has had enough time to work on this, but it seems they haven't been able to address this issue. For $270 before taxes, this pack is expensive - everything about it screams quality, other than this squeak. If Osprey fixed this issue, it would easily be a 5 star product.

B077K6BNXL.title: Squeeky and heavy pack.
B077K6BNXL.review: Osprey is a number one brand but some models are widely know to squeak around the wire support. Mine squeaked so loud it was embarrassing as well as irritating to other hikers. I contacted Osprey and they said to send it to them (my cost) and they would take a look. It was much less of a hassle to simply return to Amazon and look elsewhere for a better, quieter backpack. This is why I like ordering stuff of of Amazon.

B077K6BNXL.title: Ooh, I love my new backpack
B077K6BNXL.review: Great comfortable, light pack. The anti-gravity suspension system works and breathes well. Occasional squeaking but nothing particularly noteworthy. Abundant space to overpack, so I need to check myself with a scale. Love the fact the top is detachable, but do consider if opting to leave it at home that the pack’s folded-up rain cover lives there.This pack travels as well as you pack it. The first trip I took felt awful because I had the weight distributed all wrong-- heavy stuff (tent) hanging off the bottom, stuff strapped to the outside, and 1.5L nalgenes stuffed into the side pockets. After shedding an unnecessary 15 lbs and redistributing the load, my joy factor doubled.WARNING: I have a 33/34" waist. The belt is actually TOO BIG for me on the Large sized pack. I'm going to need to gain some weight, lolz, or find a way to buffer my hips. Two days into a backpacking trip, and the Atmos AG 65 was slipping down my backside. Really think things through carefully if you're on the M / L sizing boundary.Caveat: Last backpack I purchased was an early 1980's Jansport external frame model... when I was a pre-teen.

B077K6BNXL.title: Perfect for backpacking
B077K6BNXL.review: This pack fit me perfectly and made 32 pounds of backpacking gear feel much lighter. Highly recommend to any broad shouldered female (like me) or male. I purchased the Mens Small and I only stand at 5’6 tall and 180 lbs, but can be adjusted up… I currently have it set to the shortest torso length.

B077K6BNXL.title: Lite on volume of space - I really had to stuff things in there.
B077K6BNXL.review: For the money I was expecting to be able to fit more in there. When you put a full water bag in the main compartment it reduces the amount of volume for other things. The bed roll straps are a bit short and if it rains the waterproof cover sold separately will not cover your bed roll. I wound up having to carry my bedroll by hand in the rain as the straps are hidden by the cover. I guess it's ok if the bedroll get's soaked (sarcasm). Furthermore with the rain cover on it is difficult to get the pack on as you need to thread your arms through the straps but not get hung up in the waterproof cover. If you are by yourself this can be a bit of a challenge. It can also be difficult to get the side strap compartments to unfold with the rain cover on. I wound up just foregoing using the waist belt when it was raining. I personally would recommend a poncho that will cover the whole setup if you expect to encounter rain. You'll be more comfortable and all your stuff will remain dry.The plus side is that this was a very comfortable pack to wear when dry and my shoulders never became too sore over the course of the day. It was easy to control comfort by alternately tightening and loosening the waist belt so that the hips take more or less of the load.

B077K6BNXL.title: I love this backpack.

Not great, but not the worst thing either.With the body, 150-600mm lens, the Canon kit lens and a 16-35mm lens, the pack was pretty full. Room for a flash and a few sundries but nothing more. I can’t imagine adding a 15” laptop to the weight and finding this at all comfortable to carry. It wasn’t that comfortable with those items I listed above.The major flaw, however, IMO is the lack of any sort of strap to slide it onto the telescopic handle of luggage. I can’t even remember the last backpack I bought that doesn’t have this feature and I was flabbergasted to find it missing when I did a dry run in the house with the pack and suitcase. B079K8L72H.title: Perfect for the outdoorsman or professional photographer
B079K8L72H.review: Now, I'm no professional photographer, but I do own a Canon 30D with a 200mm Tamron lens, a 50mm lens, a 35mm Canon A1 film camera with a lens on it, and two other lenses for it as well. This backpack holds all of them perfectly with extra space for my film autowinder, extra rolls of film, and other extra little gear like tripod attachments, camera straps, and remotes. This thing is incredible. I got this backpack because I was tired of having camera equipment lying around because it wouldn't fit in my smaller bag. I wanted to be able to store everything in one spot and be able to know where everything is. I also wanted a backpack I can grow into, so I needed one with extra space for when I upgrade my camera body and buy additional lenses. This has everything and more.I had spinal fusion surgery a little under 5 years ago to correct scoliosis and I have 15 of my vertebrae fused. Ever since then, finding a backpack that doesn't cause me serious amounts of back pain has been a challenge, which sucks because I'm an avid hiker and carry heavy gear on those hikes. Because of the ability to adjust the tops of the straps on the backpack, as well as there being a chest strap and waist belt, I can have my backpack fully loaded, weighing well over 15 pounds, and I get zero back pain. Everything is fully adjustible, which is a dream. I also get a lot of neck pain because it is pretty much the only part of my spine I can move and bend, and there is always a lot of tension there. The included caribiner straps on the shoulder straps are amazing! I hook my film camera to it and it takes the weight off of my neck, which eliminates the need for a strap for it all together. I never would have thought of ever wanting something like that, but it was such a smart move.The laptop pocket is a little bit cramped when fully loaded, even for my 13 inch 2022 Macbook Air, which is already pretty slim, however I love the secrecy of where it's located and how to access it. The extra storage compartments within the backpack are amazing too, I keep extra Canon A1 batteries, film, and my CF card reader in those compartments.Though I haven't traveled with it just yet, I can already tell it will replace my regular backpack on more hiking centric trips. I can put both my film and digital cameras in the bottom compartment, and remove the top padding to put toiletries, clothes, and other electronic items in there. I think it would be too big to put under the seat on a plane, however it might on a bigger plane. If you're American, I definitely recommend having TSA pre-check so you don't have to unload this entire bag on the conveyer belt when in the security line, haha.The tripod slots on the side are incredibly smart. You can either put the legs into the cup holder itself, or there's a little pouch that comes out of the waist belt that can also hold the tripod legs. There are three ways of strapping it in that way, one clip strap at the top, and two adjustible ones at the middle and bottom. If you configure it correctly, you could also fit a gimble, gorilla pod, and even a drone on the side of this backpack. This configuration is on both sides of the backpack too, which is great if you want a gimble and a tripod, or a tripod and a drone, or anything you can think of.I haven't needed the extra waist bag, but it can hold an additional camera body plus a lens or two in it. It's great if you need the space, but I think it's a little bit extra for what I need the backpack for.Overall, this backpack is amazing quality and has amazing back support. I anticipate having no issues traveling with this, and it hold all of my equipment and then some. I highly recommend it for the photographer hobbyist, avid nature photographer, professionals, or anybody who just loves a good backpack (myself included). I didn't know a hybrid hiking / camera bag existed, but now I can reserve my 15L hiking backpack, with no padding for my camera (which I would literally just throw in there with a hoodie around it as padding), as a camping bag and just use this, which will keep my camera protected from myself and the elements. This thing also comes with a rain cover to make it fully waterproof. If you are considering other bags as an option, don't. You won't find anything better than this.

B079K8L72H.title: Not for quick access- great for safe transport
B079K8L72H.review: I've now had this for two years. I carry a Nikon P-1000, a d-5500, and a 500 with it for various types of shooting. I also carry two fixed zoom lenses, two telephotos (one fairly good sized), a bunch of filters, cleaning gear, chargers for all three cameras, extra batteries, a lot of cables, a ring flash, some extension tubes, and a small tripod. It's not light with all that kit in it- probably over 30 pounds. It has been on a bunch of aircraft, dragged through fields, and used in a bunch of configurations. The small included case was removed and is now a home for my wife's p-900, her batteries, and her charger. I did buy a small divider kit to improve the options for this backpack- but even through some fairly rough treatment, it has kept everything in good shape. It's pretty comfortable to wear if you take the time to set it up. Access is not fast or easy- but if you need a lot of options, this will get them there a lot better than two smaller units. The only thing that has failed is one of the pull rings on a zipper tab- not exactly catastrophic, and easily fixed. I'd buy it again (and may yet do so to have a spare).

B079K8L72H.title: Preliminary but Large version fits my travel essentials and looks to be airplane seat compatible.
B079K8L72H.review: Large version review.I searched for a backpack with decent quality and the space needed for my airline travel needs while fitting under the seat if needed in a pinch.It is full but holds the following with reasonable padding. This wont work with all this for quick access - to and from destination bundling was my key.Canon full frame mirrorless plus attached grip - the pack is deeper than some and will accommodate this. But not toward the top.100-500 lens attached - with ring and hood (reversed). Full sized binocular, travel CPAP and related items and back up battery. One additional lens - 24mm with EF adapter attached. Batteries, charger, cables and extension cord. Because of the CPAP components I would not be able to add a laptop but I do not travel with one. Maybe room left for small snacks and water bottle (slim) will fit. All this without the water bottle sure looks good for under seat stowage if required. It is heavy - 20lbs. with this load. If you travel frequently this may stress the bag and you may want to go to a higher quality level but the bag looks pretty well put together but I will be pushing it. Zippers appear reasonably good and operate pretty smoothly. The snaps get in the way but should cover a zipper failure if that ever happens. Tripod not considered in my packing. Would not fit under seat if attached.

B079K8L72H.title: Good for small kits, bottom compartment is not for 2nd camera.
B079K8L72H.review: Really do love the pack for this price point. The bottom isn’t really safe for lenses or another camera. So I use it for storage and heavy duty equipment.If it was encased in a hard shell it would be useable as a 2nd camera storage but with the soft foam where it is located I don’t feel it is worth the risk for a 2nd kit. Still a great space for other things so not a downside.Top can get cramped when bringing a 2nd camera so I have opted for Go pro and a full camera kit for my outings and it has been successful and felt secure with no nerves of damage to equipment. Extra straps and pockets are good for additional storage, water bottles extra. Sometimes the straps seem redundant and are in bad positions for quick access to other pockets but over extremely satisfied with my purchase.

B079K8L72H.title: Love it
B079K8L72H.review: It holds everything plus more.

B079K8L72H.title: Too many pockets
B079K8L72H.review: I initially thought that the way the bag was divided up would be great, but if you're on the go and taking things out and putting things back without focusing on where you put them (focusing, photography joke, haha), it quickly becomes frustrating. There are lot of pockets, maybe if each one had a different color zipper pull it would help, but each one having two orange zipper pulls just made finding things frustrating, especially if you're in a hurry.

B079K8L72H.title: Good Camera Bag
B079K8L72H.review: This is my second Tarion camera bag.My first one is the sling bag and I am still using when carrying my small set of lens.This one has much bigger and I use it to carry one mirrorless camera, a set of mixed trinity (2 f2.8 and 1 f4) lenses, a flash, a travel tripod, and still have a lot of room for accessories.Overall very solid bag and comfortable to carry around.

B079K8L72H.title: Great value
B079K8L72H.review: Great bag, Great price. Finally can carry most all of my fear with me without spending a fortune

B079K8L72H.title: Good! But...!
B079K8L72H.review: So this bag, overall is great. It has PLENTY of storage good use of space. I love the smaller pockets. The larger compartment toward the top has a zippered area to keep paperwork. The bag is layout is excellent.BUT! I can't give this bag 5 stars because an ENTIRE clip was missing from the back right side of the bag. If I had planned to used that elastic pocket for a tripod, it would never work. So, I really have some doubts about the clip stability.Otherwise, it's a great bag! Room for camera, extra clothes and room to organize the little things. On top of that, it is also comfortable to wear.I'm not planning on returning it because I can use it as is.

B079K8L72H.title: Very versatile backpack
B079K8L72H.review: I was very impressed with how customizable this backpack is. Quality is great, inside and out. I mostly use film cameras and I was able to fit my Mamiya, canon ae-1 and my canon dslr along with few accessories. It is spacious and will definitely fit most of your gear. Compared to other well known “name brands” this Tarion backpack in my opinion works perfectly well. The price is really fair. I bought this to fit most of my gear for travel and it does the job plus wearing feels great as well.

B079K8L72H.title: Holds a lot of Gear
B079K8L72H.review: The bag itself is pretty roomy.I was able to get my Canon EOSand Canon GH50in the backpack plus the gear that goes with it.The improvement could be on the side of the back for securing an external Lens Bag.I bought a new bag for my 600mm Sigma lens that had better options to attach to a backpack.I did get it awkwardly attached.Overall, I would recommend this bag.

B079K8L72H.title: Nice bag
B079K8L72H.review: Nice bag, but I had to return it because it wouldn't work for my needs.

B079K8L72H.title: Good bag, not perfect
B079K8L72H.review: This bag was definitely designed for photographers in mind.There are plenty of little pouches and zippered compartments to carry all the extras like batteries, chargers, cards, lens wipes, etc and there is good space for taking a fair amount of lenses with you.The section for the camera body will fit a mirrorless much better than a larger DSLR.I carry around the 14-24, 24-70 and maybe a prime in the main section and put the 70-200 in the lower section as it won't really fit on the camera.And that brings me to the one downside.The adjustable sections which are held with velcro don't really hold.It doesn't take long for the velcro to give way when you're putting your camera in the bag and it's just not the secure fit I'd want.I don't need expensive lenses banging into each other.So that's the downside.I also notice the zipper catches sometimes and leads me to think that's going to be an issue one day.It's built well, for the money it's a good bag, but if you need "The best" bag, this isn't it.But for what it is, this looks good, it's easy to carry, it carries a lot, there's a good amount of space, and room for the extras.

B079K8L72H.title: So many compartments!
B079K8L72H.review: It's got compartments for your compartments! Took it on a hike recently and had everything easily accessible when it was time to take photos. Good stuff!Update: took the bag as my personal item for a trip and upon arriving to the hotel the entire zipped compartment for the laptop zipped open and my laptop fell and broke.The zipper part for the laptop goes all the way down one side, so the weight from the bag will naturally pull it open if not zipped perfectly. Poor design in that aspectSolution: stick a pin on the otherside where the zipper would slide down.

B079K8L72H.title: Great Customer Service and the bag is packed full of features!
B079K8L72H.review: I really like this camera backpack! It has plenty of features that work well for me (a novice photographer). I use it casually when I go on hikes and want to have my camera with for a quick picture. I like that it can hold my tripod, water bottles on the sides, and all my lenses. I also got it so I can bring it on a flight with me as a carry on backpack. I unfortunately broke one of the clips in the car door. However, I asked if they can get the clips to me separately and the company sent me a box with like 6 or 7 of them. I wish the clips were easier to replace but overall I was able to do it. Great, durable product and great customer service! Oh, I also like that it has a whistle in case I want to say hi to nature. And the extra fanny pack camera bag is very useful.

With the padded inserts, it only fits one body, a med-long lens, and then only a couple short primes wedged into the corners.

B07HF3X6Y4.title: Small but works miracles
B07HF3X6Y4.review: When I made my buy, I did not take the time to read the reviews or even consider the advantages and disadvantages of the product. I wanted to try it, and I saw this one, and it was reasonably priced, so I only thought twice before purchasing. This steamer would be a good investment for people like me who do their laundry to ensure few wrinkles; however, no matter how hard you try, you will always have a wrinkle here and there. And this steamer is small but works miracles when it comes to those tiny wrinkles. It is travel friendly, easy to store, and compact. I am satisfied with the purchase because I knew it was something other than what I would use daily. There are instances when a minor crease in my clothing makes me lazy about getting out the iron and performing all that extra work. I did not need it for anything significant, in other words.I was excited to try it when it arrived, so I did. At first, I was frightened because there did not appear to be any steam coming out, but after 3 minutes, I saw smoke, so I recommend giving it some time after being plugged in to get it operating. I had never used a steamer before and was highly pleased. It contains enough water to complete at least one outfit. To avoid water spurting out, don't fill it up. Be cautioned not to put your hands or skin too close to the blue nozzle because this machine part gets hot. Despite being portable and simple, I tried a steamer because it doesn't leave wrinkles and lines like an iron. And just as expected, the steam did wonders for me in removing wrinkles. I also used the included brush, which worked equally effectively both ways. Although it works wonders, I would not suggest it to someone who plans to use it frequently because it is time-consuming and doesn't work as well on oversized clothing. This isn't to say that it doesn't work, just that you must review it a few times to get it to look exactly right. However, this is ideal if you're looking for something inexpensive, convenient for storage, and simple to use. Remember that it works best on smaller clothes because it will take less water, and you can get a lot done with one full cup. If you wanted to steam more than one piece of clothing at a time, you would have to stop often, turn the machine off, and let it cool down for a few minutes before adding more water and plugging it back in, and then wait another three minutes for the steam to resume. It has undoubtedly been put to use and has been helpful on numerous occasions. Getting wrinkle-free clothing has become necessary for travel and daily life. The functionality of this product is excellent, given its size and cost.  The product heats up quickly and is a perfectly manageable size. Use filtered or purified water to avoid limescale buildup that could damage equipment and stain garments. Although it removes wrinkles rapidly, it cannot replace ironing. The product is excellent overall, and I suggest it unless you plan to use it frequently for formal attire because doing so requires a lot of time. But don't let it deter you from purchasing it. I'm sure you will love it as much as I do and will use it extensively. People like me who take their time with their laundry to ensure minimal wrinkles would benefit from investing in this steamer. Despite our best efforts, there will inevitably be a few wrinkles here and there.

B07HF3X6Y4.title: Makes A Mess
B07HF3X6Y4.review: A steamer is a must have for me as I wear a lot of delicate garments, this one does a decent job aside from the fact that you have 20 seconds to get the job done before it starts spewing water all over your garments. I’ve had to follow behind the steamer with a blow dryer on multiple occasions to save myself from looking like I came out of a splash pad because the water spewing is so bad. I keep the water level below the max fill line, yet I have an issue every time I have to use the machine.

B07HF3X6Y4.title: Water spitting out everywhere
B07HF3X6Y4.review: First test was great, short run, tiny bits of water in the can, and the steam was excellent. No issue, with quick 3 minute check. Second run ( more water but still below the max line) big droplet of water spit out continuously until there were only tiny bits of water left in the can, then it worked smoothly.So I think not as advertised ‘15 min continuous steam’ and don’t trust the max waterline. In theory this thing works but as water boils, the heat plate is too close to the top opening, the water ended up boiling over top openings.A longer nozzle head, a bigger chamber or a lower max line probably would have make this work a little longer and safer. If you just want a quick single shirt steamed, this is probably great since it’s so tiny and travels well.

B07HF3X6Y4.review: Got this before our son got married out of town so I had something to use on my dress if it wrinkled. I've used it numerous times to freshen blouses and shirts since that event. It heats quickly and steams real well. I have had a steamer before and it really didn't work very well at all. It used to leak water more than steam it. This does an all around great job.

B07HF3X6Y4.title: Light weight, nice size for traveling but…
B07HF3X6Y4.review: I had my last steamer- the kind that is on wheels with a pole to hang clothes from- for 11 years. It was time to get something new and I wanted one that didn’t take up as much space and I could take with me on vacations. This one had over 90k reviews- mostly positive- so I figured I’d grab it while it was on sale.It arrived same day, it was simple to “put together” and use immediately. It is very lightweight and I’d say takes up as much space as a classic blow dryer if I were to pack it in a suitcase/overnight bag.It took a bit to heat up, my larger one had a much bigger water tank and I feel like it took about 30s to heat up. This little guy has like a cup of water in its tank and it probably took closer to a minute to boil the water. Not a big deal just something I noticed.The steam comes out with some force so I was impressed with that-my other steamer just seemed to allow the steam to just float out of the hose attachment.I used this steamer on 2 satin feeling camisoles that where just purchased and taken out of the packaging so they were in pretty bad shape with wrinkles and fold marks. This steamer did a pretty good job at removing all of the wrinkles in 1-3 passes. The biggest negative for me was that it sputters water a bit. I had this issues with my older steamer so it’s not a huge deal breaker, and so far I have had 0 issues with water stains but I can imagine on very delicate materials it could be bad. I also didn’t experience these droplets spilling onto my skin but the water is at boiling point so I would be careful.Overall for the sale price of 22$, I’m willing to keep this little guy and use it as my travel steamer. I still have my trustee old steamer just in case this one doesn’t last.

B07HF3X6Y4.title: Heats up fast

B009S750LA.title: Works well for two 27inch monitors.
B009S750LA.review: VIVO Dual Monitor Desk Mount in white; I use it for two LG 27 inch monitors. I liked that I could match the color of the arm to the backs of the monitors, but black is also available.My monitors are fairly light, and I have not had any trouble getting the arms to stay in place. There is a convenient holder for the Allen (hex) wrenches that the mount comes with, which is a nice feature. It also comes with guides for cables.Like most flexible systems like this, I have a problem getting the monitors to align perfectly in the middle. I've resorted to strapping 3/4 inch velcro around the the inside/touching edges of the monitors - it forces them into vertical alignment and closes the gap that would otherwise allow sunlight through my windows to be really distracting. If you have super nice monitors that have small (or absent) bevels, something like that wouldn't work well (although I've seen other hacks online that could help).The stand comes with the C clamp mount that you can screw on; there's a layer of rubber padding to reduce the possibility of damaging the finish of your desk. There's also an option to bolt the whole system onto a solid wood surface if your desk doesn't have a ledge large enough for the clamp. I would never... but your mileage may vary.In retrospect, since I don't rotate my monitors to vertical positions, I'd rather have something where the mounts don't rotate, so will always hold the monitors perfectly even with each other, but I'm pretty happy with this system.

B009S750LA.title: You get what you pay for...
B009S750LA.review: I really, really wanted to like this mount, but in reality it gave me trouble every step of the way. The mount does what the listing says, it's useable, but it has a lot of design flaws that prevent me from really liking it.The problems began with assembly. I have a desk with a tiered shelf and the shelf is what I needed to attach the mount to. I had a solid 5-6 inches to work with and the mounting clamp and screw that holds it to the desk was far too longto fit in place. I wound up having to improvise with the design of the clamp and the spacers provided to get it to fit my desk.That alone wasn't a major issue, and more on me than the manufacturer, but my biggest gripe with this mount are the brackets that actually hold the monitors to the mounting arms: They are far too loose. In the package you get a set of A6 and A4 screws, my monitors need A4's. The A6 screws are all metal and are fine. The A4's on the other hand are thumb-tightening screws, which means they have a plastic cap attached at the end for easy tightening. In order to secure the mounting plate I have to really tighten these screws. Unfortunately due to the incredibly cheap plastic the caps are made out of the hole for screwdrivers will immediately strip if you apply any significant amount of tightening force to it. If you plan on using this mount, get your own all-metal A4 screws to fix the plates on. (Also of note, at least two of the hex bolts I received with the hardware were also stripped to some extent)Of course, the plates themselves are also an issue, they are too loose and don't fit securely enough. They do not slot tightly into the arm nor do they include a tool to completely tighten the nuts that affix the plates to the arm. This results in monitors that are loose enough that they noticeably wobble if you lightly bump the desk or even type too hard.That being said, I built the mount and attached the monitors anyway out of stubbornness as I was committed and had already put in the effort. Overall, the mount looks fine, but the arms to move them are more stiff than I'd like, making them difficult to move at times, and with the design if you need to push them back you'll have to make sure you have some room between the back of your desk and any walls behind it to avoid scratching them.Also included in the package are some cable management clips that fit onto the mount's arms and shaft, which are a nice little addition, however like the mounting plates they also fit pretty loosely onto the arms and move way too easily once attached. If you have zip-ties or some other fastener use those instead for cleaner cables.Overall, you get what you pay for, and I can't say I recommend the product. If you want the cheapest possible mount that actually functions, but has noticeable issues, sure. However, if you want a proper mount it would be worth it to pay out a little more for something more expensive, higher-quality, and built to more precise tolerances.

B086X7QKHD.title: Disaster

The battery that was shipped with the device didn't work.Not hibernating; even after 10 hours on charger, no power.Fortunately I had other batteries.Fail.3. Tried to update the firmware.Total disaster.Hangs with no error messages; after rebooting, says there is an ERC issue (which only occurred AFTER I tried to update the firmware).I have spent 8 hours trying every possible premutation of setup, switching out hardware, etc.Customer support totally useless; I got more information from other users and googling than I got from customer support.4. I am returning this product.Worst experience with any product I have purchased on Amazon.For the price that one pays for this (>$1000 US), it is unfathomable to me that you would roll out a firmware that bricks a perfectly good device.The fact that the battery and the power chord didn't work / wrong cord issues were tolerable, I could work through them... but the firmware piece is just too much.Zero starts.

B086X7QKHD.title: The Saga of the Drone in a Tree.
B086X7QKHD.review: I originally purchased this Drone in August of 2021, this was my very first Drone. I wanted something that had some advanced features to help me as a new flyer and took amazing Video\Photos. This delivers on all points! Epic Photos and epic video, follow a subject mode, The ultimate FLYING cameraman. I got some flight time in and got a little practice. My backyard is basically a fairy tale forest in western PA, complete with a stream I can watch the animals drink from. So there were no shortage of amazing shots to take or my wife could live stream from it on hikes. To play around flying in my house to get some fine control skills down a bit I turned off the perimeter safety. Then after the battery was charged I went flying farther outside for some epic shots. Forgetting I turned off the perimeter warnings I got too close to a tree and the unthinkable happened. Yeah only careless people get their drones stuck in a tree that could NEVER happen to me right? right.... :(.WRONG! I had this amazing piece of technology for all of 1 day and crashed it amazingly good 150 feet up into a tree. I finally located the exact tree with the last vestiges of my battery life with the very useful feature of it beeping and flashing. Which was still difficult through the dense foliage. (note to self invest in a self powered strobe and a bright orange skin or sticker after I retrieve the drone.). The problem with this particular tree is on the civilization side between any route in about 15 ft away from said tree is a power line, the other direction is dense bramble filled forest. This particular tree also doesn't have any branches lower than 30 ft up, Ruh Roh. I spend about 8 hours for a week straight trying to come up with ideas to knock it down.I tried Fish sticks (they are light semi bendy poles used to fish wire through walls if you are unfamiliar.), I tries throwing object at it, (Way too high up.) I researched Climbing gear but decided it was too high a risk of getting hurt. AHA! The perfect plan, buy a mavic Air 1tie fishing line and a hook around it, hook the stuck Mavic Air 2 and boom, no more stuck Drone. Then sell the extra one. So I did Just that, errr tried just that anyway.I amazingly hooked the first drone and the plan was working great, the first was really stuck though so I kicked up the throttle to full speed more with a payload. then.... the hook broken the second drone flipped over and yes you guessed it got stuck in the tree also. So here I am standing in the forest with about $1500 in a tree behind my house. Well that went south fast.So after more extensive research I make kind of a primitive pipe slingshot spear gun thing that flings a dowel that has fishing line attached and a fishing reel over the branch, then you tie stronger rope to the fishing line and use the line to pull the stronger rope over the branch, then tie off one and and pull hard back and forth till you can shake it loose. Success getting the Second Mavic air 1 out of the tree and back to safety! At this point I am about 3 weeks in and a lot of time in this forest. 4 more days with the slingshot thing and no luck getting the first one out.My wife makes an ultimatum, No more trips into the forest getting the drone while she worries or there will be no more wife. I am very fortunate and have married the woman of my dreams and my soulmate! So as much as it CRUSHED my spirit to do so I agreed because I love her. It is not in my nature to give up but for her I would do anything. The worst part is I can see the drone in the tree in the winter from my mailbox taunting me.My friend (under close supervision) let me practice and use his Mavic Air 2 which he loves. I got some great shots and lots of practice. Fast forward to Yesterday, (11-19-22) The drone was not in it's usual taunting place and the leaves have pretty much just all fallen now. This requires closer investigation. Could it be true did it finally fall from it's taunting perch? YES IT DID! so this drone has been up there through snow and rain storms quite hot days and everything unprotected for 15 months, on top of that it fell 150 ft to the ground. What kind of shape could it possibly be in? believe it or not AMAZING SHAPE! Except the battery it has discharged so much that the electronics would not allow it to charge anymore, but that was expected. It was a tiny bit scratched up and Dirty, nothing a cleaning couldn't fix. But does anything in it still work through all that weather?Well I borrowed a battery from my friend and shockingly it still works and flies without any issues! I can no longer find my case with the extra propellers or the prop guards I wish I had been using. But hey I still have the rest and it works after all that! I can't think of any more ringing of an endorsement than surviving 15 months in a tree and then a 150 ft fall. So if you want a great very durable Drone that takes amazing videos and picture I would HIGHLY recommend this one. Just stay clear of Trees while the perimeter warning system is turned off!

B086X7QKHD.title: Great all-around drone for photography and videography!
B086X7QKHD.review: While the DJI Mavic Air 2 is fairly straightforward to get operational, it does take time and practice to get good at flying it and shooting photos & video. The controller is simple and easy to use but I wish the new DJI RC Controller was compatible as that one doesn't require the use of a cellphone! Very easy to travel with this drone as it folds up very compactly. I purchased a Symik case, which is perfect for my needs. Note: some of the larger cellphones, like the Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra, may not fit in the built in phone holder. This can be remedied by purchasing an adapter that allows larger cellphones, tablets, and iPads to be used!

B086X7QKHD.title: Great product backed by amazing service
B086X7QKHD.review: I love my drone. It was the perfect size for the photography abilities it provided. Moreover, you say air caused a good crash with the gimble broken. Didn’t have an extended warranty DJ I fixed it for $100.

B086X7QKHD.title: REVIEW
B086X7QKHD.review: It was an amazing gift.

B086X7QKHD.title: Who do I contact for a new battery, one was dead??

B086X7QKHD.title: Arrived in damaged condition
